intro: Semeiostachys drobovii, commonly known as the Drobovii sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the wetlands of eastern Europe and western Asia. It typically grows in shallow water or moist soils, exhibiting a clumping growth habit with narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in spikelets, which are characteristic of the Cyperaceae family. It has fibrous roots and is often found in marshy areas, contributing to soil stabilization. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
